column1: Donald L. Mallick was an American pilot at the NASA Dryden Flight Research Center from 1963 - 1981.
He later became the Deputy Chief for the Dryden Aircraft Operations Division.

column2: In 1970 he officially retired from the Navy after achieving the rank of Lieutenant Commander.

column1: Mallick served the National Advisory Committee for Aeronautics as a test pilot from 1957 - 1963.
In 1963 he became a pilot at the Dryden Flight Research Center, and in 1967 he was promoted to Chief Pilot.

column2: While there he was a project pilot on both the YF-12 and XB-70A research programs.
